feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 15 at 4:57AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...LIGHT WINTRY MIX/FREEZING DRIZZLE POSSIBLE SATURDAY MORNING... A warm front will to move through Southcentral this morning bringing a light wintry mix of precipitation which may result in a light dusting of snow and/or a light glaze of ice on surfaces. The light mixed precipitation is expected to develop early this morning and lift across the region from southeast to northwest
entry.cap:areaDesc: Anchorage; Matanuska Valley; Susitna Valley; Western Kenai Peninsula

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued October 15 at 4:42AM AKDT until October 15 at 7:00PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM AKDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Mixed precipitation. Total snow accumulations of up to one inch and ice accumulations of up to two tenths of an inch. * WHERE...Northeast Prince William Sound. * WHEN...Until 7 PM AKDT this evening.

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued October 15 at 4:42AM AKDT until October 16 at 1:00PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM AKDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...Mixed precipitation. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 5 inches and ice accumulations of up to two tenths of an inch. * WHERE...Copper River Basin. * WHEN...Until 1 PM AKDT Sunday.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 15 at 3:44AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...High Surf Possible Sunday Night Through Monday Night. ... Northeast winds gusting to 40 mph will cause elevated water levels and elevated surf along the coast from Point Barrow to Wainwright Sunday night through Monday night. High surf is possible. The surf is expected to decrease early Tuesday as winds decrease. Beach erosion is expected.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Northern Arctic Coast; Western Arctic Coast

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 15 at 3:44AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...High Surf Possible Sunday And Sunday Night... East winds gusting to 55 mph will cause elevated water levels and elevated surf along the coast starting early Sunday. High surf is possible. The surf is expected to decrease early Monday as winds turn offshore and decrease. Beach erosion is expected. Waves could wash onto the Dock at Prudhoe Bay.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Central Beaufort Sea Coast; Eastern Beaufort Sea Coast

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 15 at 3:42AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Freezing Rain Possible This Weekend Over the Eastern Interior... A strong storm in the Gulf of Alaska will makes its way north over the Central Interior on Sunday. This will bring a slight chance of freezing rain to the southern Interior today, with a chance of freezing rain tonight and Sunday.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Central Interior; Deltana and Tanana Flats; Denali; Eastern Alaska Range; Middle Tanana Valley; Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country; Yukon Flats and Surrounding Uplands

entry.summary: ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow expected, with blizzard conditions possible. entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 15 at 12:58AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...MORE HEAVY RAIN THIS WEEKEND FOR NORTHERN SOUTHEAST ALASKA... Moderate to heavy rain has spread over the northern panhandle and will begin diminishing late Saturday morning. Over the northeast Gulf Coast moderate to heavy rain will persist through the weekend. Rainfall totals will range from less than an inch over the far northern inner channels to more than 2 inches along the northeast

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 15 at 7:24AM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central La Paz and Riverside Counties through 800 AM MST... At 723 AM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Bouse, or 13 miles southeast of Parker, moving northwest at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 15 at 7:20AM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Maricopa and Pinal Counties through 745 AM MST... At 720 AM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles south of Estrella Sailport, or 25 miles southwest of Sun Lakes, moving northwest at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail.

entry.title: Flood Warning issued October 15 at 10:02AM EDT until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Florida... St Johns River Near Astor affecting Lake and Volusia Counties. .The forecast point at Astor remains in Major Flood stage and is expected to slowly decline while remaining in Major Flood through next week. Interests along the river will continue to see major flood impacts through next week.

entry.title: Flood Warning issued October 15 at 9:59AM EDT until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Florida... St Johns River Near Deland affecting Lake and Volusia Counties. .The forecast point at Deland will remain within Major Flood stage into next week while very slowly declining. entry.title: Flood Warning issued October 15 at 9:53AM EDT until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Florida... St Johns River Near Above Lake Harney affecting Seminole County. .The forecast point above Lake Harney at Geneva is experiencing major flooding. entry.summary: ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM PDT SUNDAY FOR WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONE 608... * AFFECTED AREA...In Oregon, Fire Weather Zone 608 Willamette National Forest. * WINDS...East 10 to 15 mph with gusts up to 25 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 15 percent.

entry.title: Dense Fog Advisory issued October 14 at 10:12PM PDT until October 15 at 10:00AM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...DENSE FOG ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM PDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Occasional visibility of one quarter mile or less in dense fog. * WHERE...The Douglas, Coos, and Curry county coasts. * WHEN...Until 10 AM PDT Saturday. * IMPACTS...Hazardous driving conditions due to low visibility.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Curry County Coast; South Central Oregon Coast

entry.title: Air Quality Alert issued October 14 at 12:03PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...AIR QUALITY ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM SUNDAY TO 5 PM PDT MONDAY... The Oregon Department of Environmental Quality has issued an Air Quality Advisory, which is in effect from 6 AM Sunday to 5 PM PDT Monday. An Air Quality Advisory for Smoke has been issued. Wildfires burning

entry.title: Air Quality Alert issued October 14 at 12:03PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...AIR QUALITY ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM PDT MONDAY... The Oregon Department of Environmental Quality has continued an Air Quality Advisory, which is in effect until 5 PM PDT Monday. An Air Quality Advisory for Smoke remains in effect. Wildfires burning in the region combined with forecasted conditions will cause air quality to reach unhealthy levels at times through Monday.

entry.title: Air Quality Alert issued October 14 at 11:00AM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...AIR QUALITY ALERT IN EFFECT THROUGH SATURDAY NIGHT... Oregon Department of Environmental Quality has issued an Air Pollution Advisory...in effect for Coos County through Saturday night. The Cedar Creek Fire combined with easterly winds will cause smoke concentrations to increase. Air Quality is expected to reach unhealthy levels at times within Coos County.

entry.summary: ...AIR QUALITY ALERT IN EFFECT INTO MONDAY MORNING... Oregon Department of Environmental Quality has issued an Air Pollution Advisory...in effect for Douglas County at least into Monday morning. entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 15 at 2:41AM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...NEAR CRITICAL FIRE WEATHER DANGER EXPECTED THIS AFTERNOON... Warmer temperatures, low humidity, and breezy winds will generate near critical fire danger this afternoon. The worst conditions will take place between noon and 7 pm today. People are urged to exercise extreme care with respect to outdoor activities that could cause grass or crop fires. Use extra caution

entry.title: Air Quality Alert issued October 14 at 3:11PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: An Air Quality Alert has been issued by the Washington Department of Ecology in Yakima at least through Monday for Okanogan, Chelan, and Douglas counties. Particulate matter (PM2.5) levels may vary from unhealthy to hazardous at times close to the current wildfires in Chelan and western Okanogan counties.
